In Table 2, the wettability behaviour of the coating made by various combinations of the layers are compared. The lower layer formed by MPS shows a CA around 90°. Then the film fabricated with two layers (MPS-TEOS) showed an increased contact angle of 122° due to micro-nano silica particles. However, with the combination of the full three layers, MPS-TEOS-POTS, a higher water CA, around 165° (Fig. 3), and a lower SA of 0.5° (SI Movie S1) was formed. Therefore, silica nanoparticles modified by the addition of the lower energy compound POTS, greatly increases the hydrophobicity of the layers. The results show a synergetic effect between dual scale micro/nano particles and low surface energy species
44 . The randomly distributed silica particles created by deposition of MPS and TEOS, with a moderately dense coverage of the surface and POTS enables the superhydrophobic properties to be achieved.
